It seems like in 1.16 MCPE (Bedrock) wolves are now spawning in many biomes and are killing all the sheep. I'm not happy about it.
This would be a great feature to have on consoles aswell
Yeah that too
I've always wondered why they never implimented this on bedrock. It must be how maps are processed in java vs bedrock.
Yeah,the attack animation on bedrock is poor
They also shoot arrows really fast. They need slowed down to match java as well as dodging

Skeletons behave much smarter in Java edition by sliding from side to side (Dodging), whereas on bedrock they just stand in one place and keep shooting. Also, the arrows they shoot appear visually 5 blocks away from them making the arrows invisible within 5 blocks.
This is not the case in Java as the arrow appears immediately when they shoot it.
I almost always agree with making bedrock more like java, but in this case I feel that the shovel makes sense in the crafting recipe so java should be changed to match bedrock.
This would make it easier for specific minigames and such, but it's not that big of a feature that needs to change
the bedrock crafting recipe is just annoying so it would be nice to get the java recipe
I think that they should change it in Java to match Bedrock.

Agreed. Bedrock's version is just clunky and convoluted. It's not like Minecraft is known for its realism, after all, which is the only argument for adding the shovel at all.

Of course, if we want to get really pedantic, we can require 2 shovels in the recipe, to match the final product's appearance. You see how silly that gets?

This feature is only present on Console Edition, not bedrock! This should be added to both Java and bedrock.
I agreed that!
A good idea! I'd like to see this on Bedrock!
This is a no-brainer. The lack of this feature wastes part of the outer layer of skins.

I really enjoy playing PE, but this issue with popping message with list of enchantments not only is huge (I’ve more than 4 enchantments on my tools) but it takes up to 5 seconds to start to disappear, meanwhile it takes 1-2 sec for other items (without enchantments). It is very annoying

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.

This feature is a great idea to import over to bedrock but a small tweak id like to suggest to your original post is; toolbar saving across xbox live, or for people who dont have xbox live local storage.
I forgot that you Bedrock players don't have this! I will support this tremendously!
6 Toolbars stored locally, 3 Toolbars stored globally in your account.

Good idea @TheGoldNinja101!

Oh, and one post suggestion: Add the saved toolbars for m0 and m2 too, but they load the items from the inventory.
Completely agree! I find to make certain things, I use certain tools and materials and I’d like to be able to recall certain toolbars for creating things, or for mining, or for fighting, etc.
Fantastic idea, I was just looking for this post to suggest this for Minecraft Earth as well! Having a different toolbar for adventures vs building would be so helpful.

Seeing as mobile and console players don't have many buttons to work with, I'd like if the toolbar hotkeys (the buttons to save and load toolbars into the player's hotbar) were placed in the toolbar menu. Basically, if you wanted to save your hotbar to toolbar number three, you would have to navigate to the toolbar menu in your inventory, then press a button once there.
The tick speed in bedrock is far too slow, I have a bamboo farm that feeds bamboo into a furnace to smelt cactus and it is so slow it basically breaks the entire set up...

I would love this to be changed so that we can increase the randomTickSpeed to at least Java's 3 without cheats. It's a bother that to build anything on par with Java's farms (without cheats), Bedrock's farms need to be triple the size :/

I think there is some confusion regarding the java bedrock parity. The number value in bedrock is not equivalent to the number value in java. The 1 for bedrock is equal to java's 3. The crops grow the same speed the number is just different. This feature request explains about how bedrock cant slow down the random tick speed without removing random ticks entirely

Random tick speeds are the amount of blocks updated per tick. The area to be ticked is each loaded sub chunk (16x16x16). Java gets three blocks in that area updated whereas bedrock only gets one. They are exactly the same definitions making java three times faster.
I like the bedrock random tick speed the way it is. Easier is not better. (in my opinion)
Please please please add this for mobile.
After new touch controls being added it should be easy to implement. It will be helpful for restoring the health of a mending item . And much more ....
light touch for using offhand, heavy touch for using onhand?(even though i'm not sure if there's that technology)

1) what about people who don't use split controls?

2) I agree with the first bit, but the second bit should be more like this:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/22935702808589-The-Offhand-Slot-On-Bedrock-Edition-Touchscreen-Devices
And This will help Bedrock Players Fighting wither too
In my opinion easier is not better.

They don't actually care about parity anyway, so this won't be changed, but it would be nice to be able to recover in combat by eating instead of having to run away and hide in a box waiting for minutes for your health to regenerate.
Skill issue
I completely agree with faster healing from food for Bedrock. Why hasn't it been done yet??

I would like to apologize to you, I literally just posted a Parity update idea, and was sure that no one had done it yet, I even checked before hand, but then I just saw yours and I feel stupid, sorry for inadvertently stealing your idea, but also COMPLETELY AGREE, not for 1.19 but maybe 1.20, but it should 100% happen
PLEASE vote people so that this can happen. :))))))
It's an okay idea but java players might find it bland

I completely agree. There are so many features missing from the edition I play (java), like dyeable shulkers and waterlogged repeaters and it frustrates me. And I am sure Bedrock players can find other things missing from their edition that frustrates them.

 

Mojang, please make a parity update.

I play on bedrock mainly, and I always see other people doing cool java only things, and sometimes I just wish those features were on bedrock.  And when I do play java, I always miss some of the bedrock exclusive features

I was having some ideas for a redstone update, merge some features of bedrock and java, for example in bedrock the redstone connects directly with pistons, observers etc.. but there is no possibility for the redstone to load blocks indirectly... That only happens in Java by merging these two options. I think the quasi-connectivity bug could be completely eliminated.

I'm not a programmer and I have many ideas to improve the redstone but I don't know how to explain it...

English Translation:
Title: "MobCap Increases and Spawn Chunks in the Bedrock version"
Post: "The number of mobs increases per loaded zone; Now contrary to having 16 mobs per charged zone it increases to 48 per charged zone in any Simulation distance and the Spawn and Despawn system would remain the same in Java and Bedrock In any Simulation distance.

Spawn Chunks would be supplemented in the Bedrock version with a SpawnChunks area of 10 by 10 Chunks around our Spawn point.

This would be added in the Parity Update and would serve for Technical Minecraft players in the Bedrock Edition version.

It would serve for Mob Farms to be more efficient and Spawn chunks to have a charged zone always since the most essential farms would be placed in that zone and either any Mob or Redstone mechanism would always be active."
-translated by admin

Me parese una exelente idea ademas estaria muy bueno poro muuuuuuy buno para farmear mucha mas polvora y conseguir asta el doble que con el trident killer para hacer tnt para minar nederait y para hacer coetes de vuelo 3 para explorar mucho mas lejos y para mi que soy jugador de bedrock tecnico me parese una idea re buena y ojala la añadan al minecraft bedrock y si para los que no tienen un buen dispositivo estaria bueno que agreguen un boton para para que aparescan mas mobs y al apagarlo que genere como normal mente lo hacia pero entrando a los ajustes del mundo ojala lo lean mi comentario ❤

Me parece muy bien, lo digo mas por los cultivos y alguna otra granja que necesite estar siempre cargada para funcionar, a veces uno va a explorar por mucho tiempo y al volver los cultivos no crecieron nada
que se pueda construir en el techo del nether en minecraft bedrock y no solo que llegue hasta la capa 128, se podrian hacer mejores granjas en un minecraft tecnico

Sería como una bendición para los jugadores de bedrock, pero que Alla una manera de modificar la mobcap como los chuncks cargados desde el menú del mundo, que puedas aumentar la mobcap con un máximo de 70 con obsiones intermedias por el tema de Lag, y poder aumentar, bajar, o desabilitar los spawnchuncks
I would love them to add Spawn Chunks for Bedrock

I agree. Or at least make them craftable, with either a T of Prismarine shards with three iron on top or vice versa. Either way, they're way too difficult to get on Java. I can't even figure out how to do the loot table so it can drop any of its loot as usual but drop a trident an added 8.5% chance (granted it's possible to get two tridents this way but I digress), and I can't. I tried testing on Pillagers and nothing. But back to the subject at hand, zombies that drown should also have parity as far as spawning with tridents and Nautilus Shells. Then you can get gold, iron, carrots, potatoes, AND tridents and shells from a drowned farm.

at least make the chance of droping a trident from a drowned that is holding one as big as the loot table for drowned on bedrock. at this point it's not just double hard it's triple hard from bedrock.
They changed bedrock to match java. Gonna miss this

I think the changes make sense because tridents deal more damage than diamond swords. Making them easy to obtain at the beginning of a playthrough kinda hurts the game's progression. However I do agree that drowned holding tridents should have a higher chance to drop it. Due to their threat level being very high early game (at least in java) you probably won't be able to take on a drowned with a trident in the early game. Because of this the low drop rate doesn't accomplish anything aside from making tridents extremely tedious to get.
I agree, a youtuber did a bedrock series and he had about 37 (4) tridents!

No.

Tridents are overpowered weapons that shouldn't be easy to obtain. In fact, they should be rarer. All you need to do is make a Drowned farm.
This is the feature I need really bad
I absolutely need this, ive been starting redstone on bedrock recently and i had no idea we had so many disadvantages before i had to actually try it

I am so sorry to tell you but it would be impossible because Minecraft Java Edition uses a coding language called Java which unfortunately is not supported on consoles. Hence why they are rebuilding Minecraft but this time with a coding language that is supported on most devices which is C++.

Why did Mojang even decided to use java to program Minecraft, they should've used Lua or C++. Also, can't they just copy and paste the oringal Minecraft language code and paste it into the new program language.
well the thing I do agree is that they should at least put it on mobile devices, a really good example is pojav, maybe it’s possible to get more votes if we show discord members? Just an idea

Native Connected Textures support

I wished connected textures, like from Optifine, would be supported by default, because then we would not have so many issues, if we use Fabric or if you use the Bedrock Edition. So please add support in both versions for it.

Mojang itself could use it to give Minecraft textures more variability and seamlessness.
Glass and book shelves look so ugly without it
A multi texture layer system for emissive textures and connected textures may solve bugs like MC-280080.

Would definitely love to see blocks with borders connecting with each other especially now that additional ambiance and vibrant visuals are added which also enhance the look of the game. I'd also like to see connected textures between different types of blocks like stone bricks + cobblestone creating a cracked wall look.
connected glass makes builds look so much better! we should also have it on grass hills. connected textures are such a small change but they would be amazing to have in vanilla minecraft
